name: Lanta Pearl Beach Resort

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It is really worth going there. Of course there are many resorts on the island - but if you have ever spent some time in Lanta Pearl Beach you will come back for sure. Lovely bungalows and a large garden with huge trees. They also run a nice restaurant with delicious food; and do not forget about the bar run by NIT. Really cool and authentic. And it is family run - no chain-resort - there you can become part of the "Pearl Beach Family": So close to real Thai life. Very special. Thank you all for the last years ... I will be back ... ONE FOR THE ROAD (to all readers: if you do not understand "ONE FOR THE ROAD" - go there and find out) ... See you there ...
reviews.title: Go there ...

reviews.text: Koh Lanta is all about relaxing and Lanta Pearl is so much about that. You choice of air-conditioned cement-block cottages or wood and thatched, fan-cooled bungalows with lots of air and lots of ambiance, which were easy to fall in love with in a jungle garden atmosphere. Comfortable beds, porch with hammock, and awell-designed modern bathroom of brick and tile with hot water shower (which one hardly needs or wants on Lanta). All needs were taken care of by A and his extended family. Not right on the beach but you are close enough to see the water from bar and restaurant. Very quiet scene here, mostly couples, old and young, and many many families with young children and babies. Because the beach and the water are among the most perfect on earth! But not easy being a solo woman traveler. Also fast turnover, after a week, I had been there the longest. Also - Koh Lanta is one of the SAFEST places I have ever been in the world.
reviews.title: Great Atmosphere in Laid-back Lanta
Best on Lanta?
reviews.text: Friendly Staff, nice atmosphere, variety of rooms with good prices. Just a short walk from the best part of Long Beach which is really good and relaxed
Highly recomended for anyone that wants a true thai experience.
reviews.title: Emergency egress

reviews.text: My wife and I needed to return to Bangkok in a hurry that afternoon. The manager immediately booked us two of the few remaining seats on the evening flight from Krabi and took us in his wifes car to the airport. First class service from a great guy. By the way, all his staff are very courteous and helpful and the restaurant food we think is the best inthe area. Lovely garden surroundings and free wi-fi.
reviews.title: Excellent service from very pleasant staff.

reviews.text: Having stayed in some expensive places on our trip to Thailand, I will remember Lanta Pearl for being the best value. We had a triple room with AC (M1 perhaps) which was basic but more than adequate although the bathroom door/handle was broken and although we reported it, it wasn't fixed during the 4 nights we were there.
reviews.title: Good value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Food in the restaurant was good, close to the beach - a few minutes walk. Bar area was nice and most of the staff working there were lovely and friendly (one a bit creepy). We had no issue with the owner (just read the recent reviews) although he was very keen to get our onward travel booked with him, which we did out of politeness but know we could have got it cheaper elsewhere. Having said that, we had no problems with what we booked with him.
reviews.title: Stay elsewhere

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Would stay again and recommend.
reviews.title: Great place, arrogant owner

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here for 4 nights over the busy season. The resort is pretty average - bungalows range from little shacks to a/c huts - nothing special. We found the place had a pretty bad vibe, the staff and owner were pretty useless - and sometimes a bit rude - we had to change rooms and it was more a battle than a process. Location is good - but almost everything else is pretty bad. There are SO many nice places on Koh Lanta - I suggest to stay at one of them - not here.
reviews.title: Dirty, smelly, rude

reviews.text: A great setting just a 2 minute walk from long beach. The breakfast is also very good. The bungalows are very nice although ours didnt have a mosquito net which was rather poor as there were quite a few mozzies buzzing around when we got there.
reviews.title: Perfect end of our trip.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a bungalow in the garden for 5 days. Everything was great except the beds that where a bit too hard for our liking which i knock of a bit on the grade for (common in Thailand though). The place was peaceful and pleasent. They had reduced cleaning of room to about once every 2-3 days if you did not ask for it) which we liked. Lots of resturants and small shops nearby. Easy to get to Saladan for 50B. less then 2 minutes walk to the Beach . We had lunch and breakfast in the Restaurant and it was really good too. All service including travelagent services was fast, accurate, cost effective, professional . We really enjoyed our stay here.
reviews.title: Nice place close to long beach

reviews.text: Lucky enough to of picked Palm Beach. Excellent welcome - checkin went smoothly even if all the paperwork was not perfect (not Palm beaches problem). Very friendly owners and family. The bungalow was clean and quite - placed in small garden equipped with a hammock.
reviews.title: Excellent, Clean, Friendly

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Food was very good - recommend the battered shrimps (and the classic banana pancake) - heard that the Hot Pot was excellent..
reviews.title: Love this place!

reviews.text: The place is ca. 50m from the beach itself down a small road - and "motor-taxi's" hang outside. ATM 50m at the top of the road. Would completely recommend this place and will definitely stay here again if I get back to Lanta.
reviews.title: Good service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Me and my husband both (both in our 50's) fell in love with this place first time we stayed here. Now we have been staying for like 4 times/years and we will come back. Perl Beach is our first choise on Koh Lanta. It's like coming home. Pearl Beach is a relaxed place with friendly people. The bungalows are clean and nice. And, they don't cost you a fortune.
reviews.title: Best place of our trip

reviews.text: My wife and I recently stayed here for 4 nights and enjoyed our time. We were in the end A\C bungalow A6 and were very pleased. Basic large bedroom with comfy bed, TV and WiFi. Slate effect wet room at the back. Shower pressure could have been better but sufficed. Staff were all helpful in arranging onwards transfers and rented us a car to explore the island with (recommended if you don't want a moped). We ate at the resturaunt for breakfast twice and would recommend the banana pancakes. You are spoilt for food on the main road both nearby and 50B in a tuk tuk either way. Try Mr Green resturaunt on the main road for no fuss fresh authentic Thai food!
reviews.title: Good for the money

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If I could, I would come back to Lanta Pearl (Ko Lanta in general- my favorite island- so relaxing) every year for the rest of my life! Lanta Pearl was cute and clean, and seriously had some of the best vegetarian food of the trip. Their Spicy Chili and Basil dish was my favorite- I ended up eating it for breakfast the morning we left because I just had to have it one more time! The bungalow we stayed in (#1) was small but adequate- no bells or whistles but we spent all of our time on the beach anyway. The room itself was clean. Semi-outdoor (covered) bathroom which was actually kind of fun. Hammock on the deck (nice touch). Nice bar area with a fun bartender (Ka!) and darts. Less than 5 minute walk to the beach, very close. My only note would be, when leaving Ko Lanta via Krabi airport, TAKE A TAXI. We took a minibus that was packed to the gills with people and luggage- it was pretty uncomfortable. Especially when that guy ate an egg sandwich about halfway through the trip. I'm serious. ANYWAY. Lanta Pearl: definitely a good value, great food, good service!
reviews.title: Great Vegetarian Food, Cute & Clean!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If you are planning a trip to Koh Lanta then Pearl Beach is perfect. This family run resort offers great value for money and a wonderful personal and friendly service. They make you feel part of the family from the start. The accommodation is excellent from the basic upwards and the restaurant serves great Thai and western food all day. They can arrange airport transfers at reasonable rates and also many day trips / excursions. This is our second year at Pearl and we will back again next year for sure.
reviews.title: Pearl Beach Resort -

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If you like a place that is relaxing, with very good food and nice people....then this is the place to go to.
reviews.title: relax....

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We like the fan bungalows but there are also very nice aircon bungalows. They do good thai food and western food. only a 50m stroll to the nicest beach of lanta, very nice gardens around the resort. And the best....brilliant open air bar to chill out after a hard day at the beach :-).We come here since 3 years and stay usually for a month and never have been disappointed.
reviews.title: Steps to beach; basic accommodations

description: Welcome to Lanta Pearl Beach Bungalow Resort in the middle of the beautiful Long Beach (Phra Ae Beach) on Ko Lanta. This bungalow resort is one of Ko Lanta's oldest and almost last family-run resorts on the island. But despite the fact of a continuously growing popularity of the area, the 3 generation of family members running this place manage to hold up a true sense of Thai authenticity & hospitality until these days.
